clues.text: Mazatlan, which means "place of deer" in the Nahuatl language, is a resort city in this country
This English county's name was derived from Old English for "South Saxons", Suth Seaxe
Durban, a city in this country, was named for Sir Benjamin D'Urban, a governor of the Cape Colony
Chilean seaport whose name is Spanish for "valley of paradise"
The name of this grand duchy comes from a Germanic word for "little fortress"
In the Lord's Prayer, the 2 places our Father's will be done
George Hensley of Tenn. started the practice of "handling" these creatures in his ministry before 1910
As King James is known for his Bible, Caliph Uthman is known for this holy book
There's a Roman Catholic devotion to this part of Jesus, a symbol of his love for humanity
Nyingmapa Buddhists are distinguished from the Gelugpa Sect by the color of these
Thomas A. Hendricks for his first term & Adlai E. Stevenson for his second
After serving as sheriff of Erie County, N.Y., Cleveland became mayor of this city in Erie County
Cleveland sent federal troops to Illinois to intervene in a strike of these workers led by Eugene V. Debs
Cleveland was defeated for president by this man in 1888 & defeated him in 1892
Cleveland tried in vain to restore this queen to the throne of Hawaii

rounds.category: SONGS FOR EVERY MEMBER OF THE FAMILY

clues.text:
George Michael:
"____ Figure"

Kansas:
"Carry On Wayward ____"

Elmo & Patsy:
"____ Got Run Over By A Reindeer"

D.J. Jazzy Jeff & the Fresh Prince:
"____ Just Don't Understand"

Pearl Jam, 1993:
"____"
Chrysler, General Motors & this are the "Big 3" automakers
With a Latin name meaning "I roll", this Swedish automaker began rolling out its cars in 1927
This maker of the Impreza says that 97% of its vehicles sold in the last 10 years are still on the road today
Headquartered in Munich, it built aircraft engines before transitioning to motorcycles & cars
A charging bull graces the hood of the Aventador, a model of this Italian sports car
In 1958 African-American activist Clennon King was sent to an asylum for trying to register at this state U. in Oxford
The Congress of Racial Equality planned these 1961 trips to enforce desegregation of interstate transportation
In 1828 actor Thomas Rice began playing a blackface character named this, a term later used to describe racist laws
Civil rights activism often includes VRDs, these "Drives" to help people participate in our democracy
This discriminatory practice comes from the colorful borders on maps around areas where minorities found it hard to get loans or credit
To "make out like" this, meaning to do well, may refer not to a robber but to slang for a slot machine
Alliteration abounds in this 3-word phrase, a very uncomplicated game where you ring someone's doorbell & run away
To garner extremely high marks in a school examination is more slangily to do this 3-letter word to "that test"
Like the feedback type, in a "compulsion" this, you endlessly cycle through checking your social media apps
This numerical term for the first person to catch a certain disease now can mean the first person affected by something
On this least massive planet, you'd be .38 of your earth weight, & very hot
Your weight on this now-dwarf planet would be just .07 of your weight on Earth; that's quite a demotion
On this planet we have a friend we call Oppy, who weighed 384 pounds on Earth but is 146 up there
If you could stand on the surface of this giant gas giant, you'd weigh 2.53 times as much as you do on Earth
An object's weight on Venus is almost the same as it would be on the surface of this much larger planet discovered in 1781
The Police: "Oh, can't you see you belong to me"
Madonna: "'Cause the boy with the cold hard cash is always Mr. Right"
Joan Jett & the Blackhearts: "I saw him dancin' there by the record machine"
Bruce Springsteen: "I'm ten years burning down the road"
Janet Jackson: "No, my first name ain't baby, it's Janet"

rounds.comments: (Alex: Colleges and universities founded in the 20th century.)

clues.text: In the 1960s Marist College in Poughkeepsie began admitting them, just as nearby Vassar stopped admitting only them
BSU for short, this Idaho school has a blue artificial turf field, much to the displeasure of football purists
Florida International U. was planned in an old air control tower now called this type of "tower", a symbol of academic life
Alumni of The New School in NYC include this actor, just a few years before he memorably called for Stella
Established in Fairfax to fill a need for higher ed in Northern Va., it's named for a man who helped shape the Constitution
Adjective for a job of less than a standard number of hours a week
It describes a man's smooth face with all its whiskers removed
There's no "-proof" in this adjective often seen on kids' PJs & meaning designed to fend off flames
Hyphenated adjective for "gains" made criminally or unfairly
Adjective for one who always seems to have a greater than average number of mishaps
Steamboat whiz Fulton
19th century "Pathfinder" & politician Fremont
Novelist & sometime Iowa resident Smiley
Socialist candidate Debs, middle initial V.
Lorenzo de Medici's paternal grandfather

rounds.text: It has the most water area of any country, nearly 350,000 square miles, about 9% of its total area
